ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Unlike other courses where presentations are mostly graded based on the material presented, this course provided an opportunity to concentrate on the way you deliver that material and was extremely useful, regardless of your interests.
Everyone should take this course - should be required!
William was great in hammering home the value and techniques of strong, clear communication.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: This course provided some good basic guidelines on communication tools - presentation skills especially. I feel more confident about presenting than I did before this class.
The course provided a very open and comfortable environment in which to gain useful feedback and really helped me improve my communication skills. 1
Material is highly relevant and useful to just about everyone.
Feedback on weaknesses displayed during class activities.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Very few aspects of this course require any improvement at all. I did feel that more than one lesson (perhaps 2 out of the 6) could have been more focused on writing as opposed to verbal communication.
Pace is slightly rushed.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I thought it was great. I had wished for more discussion and feedback on "negotiations," but SOM offers that as a 1.5 credit course. Alternatively, one could take that.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I think this course fits into all programs, regardless of a student's particular interests. Even if environmental writing or public speaking is not something you are interested in pursuing as a career, everyone must write and give presentations at some point and this class really helped in gaining these skills.

Communication skills are useful in just about any sector or discipline. Whether oral, written, or discursive, communication needs to be clear and effective. Improving it will always be a positive step.
Communication is key. I spend a LOT of time communicating and I feel my emails have improved a great deal because they are now more succinct (though they take me longer to write!).

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To improve my professional communication skills.
I wanted to improve my presentation skills and as a one credit course, it provided a way of doing so with minimal stress.
To enhance my confidence in public speaking
Improved communication skills
Communication skills are super important

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: More or less.
Yes, the skills I gained from the course fully meet my expectations. I have noticed improvement in my presentations since taking this course.
Yes!
Yes, mostly. Could have gone into a little more depth on most topics.
Yes... it exceeded expectations.
Yes. There were too many topics to tackle, and we went into little depth

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Group work (meeting/negotiation simulations, presentation groups) is integral to the course; it couldn't be done without working as a group.
1) Received feedback2) Some topics, such as negotiations, would be impossible (or largely pointless) without the interaction of a work group.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It's a good idea if your presentation skills could use polishing (which is most people).

Although it is not necessary to spend a lot of time on making and practicing your presentations for this course, I think you will gain a lot more useful feedback if you take a bit of extra time to try to match them with presentations you would give in any other course.
Do all the work and take it seriously; the more you put in, the more you get out.
Absolutely. William Vance is a master at communications and almost all FES students would benefit from this course.
